alert.note: Alert for Grundy; Livingston (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued May 07 at 9:08PM CDT until May 07 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A DUST STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT FOR LIVINGSTON AND SOUTHERN GRUNDY COUNTIES... At 907 PM CDT, a wall of dust was along a line extending from near Mazon to Odell to Lexington, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Near zero visibility with damaging wind in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Emergency Management. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. Including the following interstate... I-55 between mile markers 188 and 229. This dust channel will be near... Gardner and Saunemin around 920 PM CDT. Cullom around 935 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this dust channel include Campus, Emington, South Wilmington, Strawn, Reddick and East Brooklyn. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE! There is no safe place on a highway when a dust storm hits. Visibility can be lost immediately, making it difficult or impossible to slow down and avoid stopped vehicles. Delay travel, or safely exit the highway before the dust storm arrives. Strong to severe thunderstorms are also possible behind this wall of dust. Keep updated with this quickly evolving situation.
